Row.Text: All Civilizations are Unlocked.
Unlock this Civilization in the [B]Exploration[/B] Age.
Unlock this Civilization in the [B]Modern[/B] Age.
Play as [B]Aksum[/B].
[B]Aksum[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Songhai[/B].
Play as [B]Egypt[/B].
[B]Egypt[/B] was later ruled by the [B]Abbasids[/B].
[B]Egypt[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Songhai[/B].
Play as [B]Greece[/B].
[B]Greece[/B] was from the same continent as the [B]Normans[/B].
[B]Greece[/B] and [B]Spain[/B] were both Mediterranean powers.
[B]Greece[/B] had an influence on [B]Russia[/B].
Play as [B]Han[/B].
[B]Han[/B] was a precursor Civilization to [B]Ming[/B].
[B]Han[/B] was from the same region as the [B]Mongols[/B].
[B]Han[/B] was a precursor Civilization to [B]Qing[/B].
Play as [B]Khmer[/B].
[B]Khmer[/B] and the [B]Chola[/B] were a part of the Sanskrit world.
[B]Khmer[/B] was from the same region as [B]Majapahit[/B].
[B]Khmer[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Meiji Japan[/B].
[B]Khmer[/B] influenced the development of [B]Siam[/B].
Play as [B]Maurya[/B].
The [B]Maurya[/B] influenced the development of the [B]Chola[/B].
The [B]Maurya[/B] influenced the development of [B]Majapahit[/B].
Play as the [B]Maya[/B].
The [B]Maya[/B] and [B]Hawai'i[/B] are both Pacific powers.
The [B]Maya[/B] and the [B]Inca[/B] are both indigenous cultures of the Americas.
[B]Maya[/B] was a precursor Civilization to [B]Mexico[/B].
Play as the [B]Mississippians[/B].
The [B]Mississippians[/B] offer a complementary playstyle to [B]Hawai'i[/B].
The [B]Mississippians[/B] and the [B]Inca[/B] are both indigenous cultures of the Americas.
Play as [B]Achaemenid Persia[/B].
[B]Achaemenid Persia[/B] influenced the development of the [B]Abbasids[/B].
[B]Achaemenid Persia[/B] influenced later rulers of [B]Mongolia[/B].
[B]Achaemenid Persia[/B] influenced the development of the [B]Mughals[/B].
Play as [B]Rome[/B].
[B]Rome[/B] was from the same continent as the [B]Normans[/B].
[B]Rome[/B] was a precursor Civilization to [B]Spain[/B].
[B]Rome[/B] influenced the founding ideals of [B]America[/B].
[B]Rome[/B] was a precursor Civilization to the [B]French Empire[/B].
[B]Rome[/B] influenced the development of [B]Prussia[/B].
Play as the [B]Abbasids[/B].
The [B]Abbasids[/B] offer a complementary playstyle to [B]Buganda[/B].
The [B]Abbasids[/B] influenced the development of the [B]Mughal[/B].
Play as [B]Chola[/B].
[B]Chola[/B] was a precursor Civilization to [B]Mughal[/B].
The [B]Chola[/B] influenced the development of [B]Siam[/B].
Play as [B]Hawai'i[/B].
[B]Hawai'i[/B] and [B]Meiji Japan[/B] were both Pacific powers.
Play as the [B]Inca[/B].
The [B]Inca[/B] and [B]Mexico[/B] were both in the Americas.
Play as [B]Majapahit[/B].
[B]Majapahit[/B] playstyle is complementary to [B]Meiji Japan[/B].
Play as [B]Ming[/B].
[B]Ming[/B] was a precursor Civilization to [B]Qing[/B].
Play as [B]Mongolia[/B].
[B]Mongolia[/B] influenced a preceding dynasty to [B]Qing[/B].
[B]Mongolia[/B] influenced the development of [B]Russia[/B].
Play as the [B]Normans[/B].
The [B]Norman[/B] culture had an influence on [B]America[/B].
The [B]Normans[/B] first occupied lands that would later become the [B]French Empire[/B].
Play as [B]Songhai[/B].
[B]Songhai[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Buganda[/B].
Play as [B]Spain[/B].
[B]Spain[/B] was a precursor Civilization to [B]Mexico[/B].
Play as [B]Amina[/B].
[B]Amina[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Aksum[/B].
[B]Amina[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Egypt[/B].
[B]Amina[/B] was from the same region as [B]Songhai[/B].
[B]Amina[/B] and the [B]Abbasids[/B] were both Muslim.
[B]Amina[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Buganda[/B].
[B]Mexico[/B] strategically complements [B]Amina[/B].
Play as [B]Ashoka, World Renouncer[/B].
[B]Ashoka[/B] was from the same region as the [B]Chola[/B].
[B]Ashoka[/B] ruled [B]Maurya[/B].
[B]Ashoka[/B] influenced [B]Khmer[/B] culture.
[B]Hawai'i[/B] strategically complements [B]Ashoka[/B].
[B]Ashoka[/B] ruled the same region as the [B]Mughal[/B].
[B]Ashoka[/B] influenced [B]Siamese[/B] culture.
Play as [B]Augustus[/B].
[B]Augustus[/B] ruled [B]Rome[/B].
[B]Augustus's[/B] [B]Rome[/B] influenced the [B]Abbasids[/B].
[B]Augustus[/B] ruled [B]Egypt[/B].
[B]Augustus[/B] ruled [B]Spain[/B] when it was part of Rome.
[B]Augustus's[/B] [B]Rome[/B] influenced [B]Prussia[/B].
[B]Augustus's[/B] [B]Rome[/B] influenced the [B]French[/B].
Play as [B]Catherine[/B].
[B]Catherine[/B] ruled [B]Russia[/B].
The [B]Normans[/B] strategically complement [B]Catherine[/B].
[B]Catherine[/B] drew influence from [B]Greek[/B] ideas.
[B]Catherine[/B] drew influence from [B]Roman[/B] ideas.
[B]Catherine's[/B] Russia was once ruled by the [B]Mongols[/B].
[B]Catherine[/B] was born near [B]Prussia[/B].
Play as [B]Charlemagne[/B].
[B]Charlemagne[/B] styled himself as a [B]Roman[/B] successor.
[B]Charlemagne[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Greece[/B].
[B]Charlemagne[/B] ruled [B]Normandy[/B].
[B]Charlemagne[/B] fought in [B]Spain[/B].
[B]Charlemagne[/B] ruled medieval [B]France[/B].
[B]Charlemagne[/B] ruled part of the [B]Prussian[/B] region.
Play as [B]Confucius[/B].
[B]Han[/B] drew inspiration from [B]Confucius[/B].
[B]Ming[/B] drew inspiration from [B]Confucius[/B].
The Yuan Dynasty drew inspiration from [B]Confucius[/B].
[B]Qing[/B] drew inspiration from [B]Confucius[/B].
Play as [B]Benjamin Franklin[/B].
[B]Benjamin Franklin[/B] drew influence from [B]Roman[/B] ideas.
[B]Benjamin Franklin[/B] drew influence from [B]Greek[/B] ideas.
[B]Benjamin Franklin[/B] shares a cultural link with the [B]Normans[/B].
[B]Spain[/B] strategically complements [B]Benjamin Franklin[/B].
[B]Benjamin Franklin[/B] was a statesman in [B]America[/B].
[B]Benjamin Franklin[/B] was a diplomat in [B]France[/B].
Play as [B]Friedrich[/B].
[B]Friedrich[/B] styled himself as a [B]Roman[/B] successor.
[B]Egypt[/B] strategically complements [B]Friedrich[/B].
[B]Friedrich[/B] was from the same continent as the [B]Normans[/B].
[B]Friedrich[/B] ruled [B]Prussia[/B].
[B]Friedrich[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Spain[/B].
[B]Friedrich[/B] was influenced by [B]French[/B] culture.
Play as [B]Himiko[/B].
The [B]Mississippians[/B] strategically complement [B]Himiko[/B].
[B]Himiko[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Khmer[/B].
[B]Hawai'i[/B] strategically complements [B]Himiko[/B].
[B]Himiko[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Majapahit[/B].
[B]Himiko[/B] ruled ancient [B]Japan[/B].
[B]Himiko[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Siam[/B].
Play as [B]Ibn Battuta[/B].
[B]Ibn Battuta[/B] traveled in the same region as [B]Aksum[/B].
[B]Ibn Battuta[/B] traveled through [B]Achaemenid Persia[/B].
[B]Ibn Battuta[/B] spent a great deal of time in once [B]Abbasid[/B] regions.
[B]Ibn Battuta[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Buganda[/B].
[B]Ibn Battuta[/B] traveled in what was to become [B]Mughal[/B] India.
[B]Ibn Battuta[/B] traveled through the [B]Songhai[/B] region.
Play as [B]Isabella[/B].
[B]Isabella[/B] and [B]Greece[/B] shared the Mediterranean.
[B]Isabella[/B] and [B]Egypt[/B] shared the Mediterranean.
[B]Isabella[/B] ruled [B]Spain[/B].
Arab caliphates had an influence on [B]Isabella's[/B] Spain.
[B]Isabella's[/B] Spain had an influence on [B]Mexico[/B].
[B]Isabella[/B] is from the same region as [B]France[/B].
Play as [B]José Rizal[/B].
The [B]Mississippians[/B] strategically complement [B]José Rizal[/B].
The [B]Maya[/B] strategically complement [B]José Rizal[/B].
[B]Hawai'i's[/B] anti-colonial struggles resonate with [B]José Rizal's[/B] own.
[B]José Rizal[/B] was from the same region as [B]Majapahit[/B].
[B]José Rizal[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Meiji Japan[/B].
[B]José Rizal[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Siam[/B].
Play as [B]Lafayette[/B].
[B]Lafayette[/B] was influenced by [B]Greek[/B] ideas.
[B]Lafayette[/B] was influenced by [B]Roman[/B] ideas.
[B]Lafayette's[/B] France included [B]Normandy[/B].
[B]Lafayette[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Spain[/B].
[B]Lafayette[/B] was a statesman in [B]France[/B].
[B]Lafayette[/B] had an influence on [B]America[/B].
Play as [B]Machiavelli[/B].
[B]Machiavelli[/B] was influenced by [B]Greek[/B] ideas.
[B]Machiavelli[/B] was from the same region as [B]Rome[/B].
[B]Machiavelli[/B] was from the same continent as the [B]Normans[/B].
[B]Machiavelli[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Spain[/B].
[B]Machiavelli[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Russia[/B].
[B]Machiavelli[/B] was from the same continent as [B]France[/B].
Play as [B]Pachacuti[/B].
[B]Pachacuti[/B] was an indigenous person in the Americas.
[B]Pachacuti[/B] was an indigenous person in the Americas.
[B]Pachacuti[/B] ruled the [B]Inca[/B].
[B]Pachacuti[/B] was an indigenous person in the Americas.
[B]Pachacuti[/B] was from the Americas.
[B]Pachacuti[/B] was from the Americas.
Play as [B]Harriet Tubman[/B].
[B]Harriet Tubman's[/B] ancestors came from the same continent as [B]Egypt[/B].
[B]Harriet Tubman's[/B] ancestors came from the same continent as [B]Aksum[/B].
[B]Harriet Tubman's[/B] ancestors came from the same continent as [B]Songhai[/B].
[B]Harriet Tubman[/B] was from the Americas.
[B]Harriet Tubman[/B] was [B]American[/B].
[B]Buganda[/B] strategically complements [B]Harriet Tubman[/B].
Play as [B]Hatshepsut[/B].
[B]Hatshepsut[/B] ruled [B]Egypt[/B].
[B]Aksum[/B] was a neighbor to [B]Hatshepsut's[/B] Egypt.
[B]Abbasids[/B] later ruled what was once [B]Hatshepsut's[/B] Egypt.
[B]Hatshepsut[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Songhai[/B].
[B]Hatshepsut[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Buganda[/B].
The [B]Mughal[/B] strategically complement [B]Hatshepsut[/B].
Play as [B]Trung Trac[/B].
[B]Trung Trac[/B] was from the same region as [B]Khmer[/B].
[B]Trung Trac[/B] was from the same continent as the [B]Maurya[/B].
[B]Trung Trac[/B] was from the same region as [B]Majapahit[/B].
[B]Trung Trac[/B] was from the same continent as the [B]Chola[/B].
[B]Trung Trac[/B] was from the same region as [B]Siam[/B].
[B]Trung Trac[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Meiji Japan[/B].
Play as [B]Xerxes[/B].
[B]Xerxes[/B] ruled [B]Achaemenid Persia[/B].
[B]Xerxes[/B] was from the same region as the [B]Maurya[/B].
[B]Xerxes[/B] influenced the [B]Abbasids[/B].
[B]Mongols[/B] later captured [B]Xerxes'[/B] Achaemenid Persia.
[B]Xerxes'[/B] Achaemenid Persia had an influence on the [B]Mughal[/B].
[B]Xerxes[/B] was from a nearby region to [B]Russia[/B].
Improve three [B]Camels[/B].
[B]Camels[/B] were an important commodity to the [B]Abbasids[/B].

The camel train sways from side to side, hypnotically. These ships of the desert have brought a new prosperity to {1_Civilization_Adj} cities, and artists and thinkers recline on imported finery, and send their thoughts to what might be.
You have unlocked Abbasid by improving 3 Camels Resources.
Improve three [B]Furs[/B].
[B]Furs[/B] were an important commodity to [B]Russia[/B].
Improve three [B]Gold[/B].
[B]Gold[/B] was an important commodity to [B]Songhai[/B].
Improve three [B]Horses[/B].
[B]Horses[/B] were an important commodity to [B]Mongolia[/B].

Horses have transformed the {1_Civilization_Adj} way of life. Racing, archery, and long-distance trade are all done on horseback – some children grow up knowing the saddle better than their parents’ arms. And of these, one group has begun to dominate.
You have unlocked Mongolia by improving 3 Horses Resources.
Improve three [B]Iron[/B].
[B]Iron[/B] was an important commodity to the [B]Normans[/B].

The sword is a marker of nobility - here is a weapon that serves no purpose but for warfare: it hews no trees, it fells no deer. It lends a refined veneer over conquest, a veneer that its bearers call honor.
You have unlocked Normans by improving 3 Iron Resources.
Build five [B]Walls[/B].
[B]Walls[/B] were an important defensive measure to the [B]Normans[/B].

The gates of the city close with a dull thud as the last horses enter. Commoners believe that merchants and travelers dream of distant lands and gold; in reality, they dream of security. From behind these walls, a new order of castle-builders gains shape.
You have unlocked Normans by having 5 Walls.
Improve three [B]Ivory[/B].
[B]Ivory[/B] was an important commodity to [B]Siam[/B].

Hunters have chased the white elephant for years. Finally, they trap it in a clearing. Harnessed, it is returned to the {1_Civilization_Adj} court: a sign, the prophets say, of a great new order to come.
You have unlocked Siam by improving 3 Ivory Resources.
Improve three [B]Jade[/B].
[B]Jade[/B] was an important commodity to [B]Qing[/B].

The malleable stone, its pale green almost organic, has long been an object of desire in {1_Civilization_Adj} elite life. But a rising group of newly influential warriors has commissioned jade lions outside of their residences; whether the stone’s vitality conveys all it is purported to remains to be seen.
You have unlocked Qing by improving 3 Jade Resources.
Improve three [B]Niter[/B].
[B]Niter[/B] was an important commodity to [B]Prussia[/B].

A single crack of musket fire breaks the pre-dawn silence on the drill field—twenty guns firing perfectly in unison. A commander, listening to the confluence of precision and lethality, wonders to himself if everything could be so efficient.
You have unlocked Prussia by improving 3 Niter Resources.
Improve three [B]Pearls[/B].
Sea resources were an important commodity to [B]Majapahit[/B].
Along the coast stand community shrines, studded with precious stones, where devotees make offerings of flowers and incense. Their prayers are of gods and heroes, and a destiny of rule.
You have unlocked Majapahit by improving 3 Pearls Resources.
Improve three [B]Salt[/B].
[B]Salt[/B] was an important commodity to [B]Mughal[/B].
Have at least three [B]Trade Routes[/B] with unique Civilizations.
[B]Trade[/B] was an important part of [B]Mughal's[/B] identity.

It is from those who travel far that new dreams come. The {1_Civilization_Adj} wanderers speak a tongue merged from those of distant places, though they call {1_Civilization_Adj} lands home. Their travels have made them wealthy… and ambitious.
You have unlocked Mughal by establishing 4 Trade Routes to unique Civilizations.
Improve three [B]Silk[/B].
[B]Silk[/B] was an important commodity to [B]Ming[/B].

The silk robe has come to mark the ultimate in refinement - and prosperity. The shining cloth glitters, reflecting the light of sun and moon, and those nobles that wear it are called simply “the bright.”
You have unlocked Ming by improving 3 Silk Resources.
Improve three [B]Tea[/B].
[B]Tea[/B] was an important commodity to [B]Meiji Japan[/B].

Tea in {1_Civilization_Adj} life has become more than a drink. The tea ceremony revolves around the careful appreciation of aesthetics, refined conversation, banter and observation - that, and the appreciation of the world even as everything seems to change.
You have unlocked Meiji by improving 3 Tea Resources.
Improve three [B]Wine[/B].
[B]Wine[/B] was an important commodity to the [B]French Empire[/B].

If wine loosens the tongue, some {1_Civilization_Adj} urbanites have become masters not only of vintages and fermentation, but of philosophy and politics. Despite their nearly incomprehensible language, the newly emboldened community of thinkers and artists have begun to imagine a new way of life.
You have unlocked the French Empire by improving 3 Wine Resources.
Have two Settlements with their City Center adjacent to a [B]Lake[/B].
[B]Lakes[/B] were an important part of [B]Buganda's[/B] identity.

The watermen – this is the name that {1_Civilization_Adj} citizens have been giving to those who live in floating villages atop lakes. It began as an insult, but over time the watermen have proved invaluable for their skill in battle.
You have unlocked Buganda by building settlements adjacent to 2 Lakes.
Have three Naval [B]Trade Routes[/B].
[B]Naval Trade[/B] was an important part of [B]Majapahit's[/B] identity.

The merchant houses of the seacoast keep their eyes constantly upon the horizon. Where others see an ever-changing seascape wracked by storm, a graveyard of ships, they see a world to be discovered – and profited from.
You have unlocked Majapahit by having 3 Naval Trade Routes.
Have three Distant Land Settlements in either [B]Plains[/B] or [B]Grasslands[/B].
[B]Distant Land Settling[/B] was an important part of [B]America's[/B] identity.

Settlements in distant lands are always saturated in newness. Peopled by those for whom the old world holds stagnation, persecution, or simply boredom, this new world has begun to speak back against the old, seeing their lands not as exile, but as a home.
You have unlocked America by building 3 Distant Lands settlements in Grassland or Plains biomes.
[B]Distant Land Settling[/B] was an important part of [B]America's[/B] identity.

Settlements in distant lands are always saturated in newness. Peopled by those for whom the old world holds stagnation, persecution, or simply boredom, this new world has begun to speak back against the old, seeing their lands not as exile, but as a home.
You have unlocked America by building 3 Distant Lands settlements in Grassland or Plains biomes.
Have three Distant Land Settlements in [B]Desert[/B] or [B]Tropical[/B].
[B]Distant Land Settling[/B] was an important part of [B]Mexico's[/B] identity.

In the sun-drenched plaza, an ocean’s distance from home, a group of aristocratic youth are engaged in a loud debate, in which the {1_Civilization_Adj} name is mentioned frequently. A group of {1_Civilization_Adj} officers pass by, and they fall silent.
You have unlocked Mexico by building 3 Distant Lands settlements in a Tropical or Desert biome.
Have three Distant Land Settlements in [B]Desert[/B] or [B]Tropical[/B].
[B]Distant Land Settling[/B] was an important part of [B]Mexico's[/B] identity.

In the sun-drenched plaza, an ocean’s distance from home, a group of aristocratic youth are engaged in a loud debate, in which the {1_Civilization_Adj} name is mentioned frequently. A group of {1_Civilization_Adj} officers pass by, and they fall silent.
You have unlocked Mexico by building 3 Distant Lands settlements in a Tropical or Desert biome.
Have three [B]Army Commanders[/B].
[B]Army Commanders[/B] were an important part of [B]Prussia's[/B] identity.

{1_Civilization_Adj} commanders were once derided for their fussy attention to detail. But now this meticulous attention has yielded results: rigid, ruthless discipline. A new order is churning within the army ranks – a new vision of a bold, directed future.
You have unlocked Prussia by having 3 Army Commanders.
Have three Settlements with at least three [B]Navigable River[/B] tiles each.
[B]Navigable Rivers[/B] were an important part of [B]Songhai's[/B] identity.

The river-people are equally at home on horseback… if they can be said to be at home anywhere. Above all, they yearn for movement. This has suited {1_Civilization_Adj} ports and markets well for now, but who knows what ambitions these wanderers may hold?
You have unlocked Songhai by having 3 Cities with 3 Navigable River tiles each.
Have three Settlements with at least three [B]Mountains[/B] each.
[B]Mountains[/B] were an important part of the [B]Inca's[/B] identity.

In the shelter of the mountain peaks, among icefalls and forbidding cliffs, is a haven. Here, the mountain people build terraces in the stony ground, finding security where others see death. They may be a source of refuge, in a crisis.
You have unlocked the Inca by having 3 cities with at least 3 Mountain tiles each.
Have three Settlements with City Centers adjacent to a [B]Coastal[/B] tile. Cities only adjacent to Lakes do not count.
[B]Ports[/B] were an important part of the [B]Chola's[/B] identity.

Among the nobles of the coast, a new and powerful dynasty arises, one whose dreams lie as much in coin and sail as in crowns and soldiers. They are at present a secondary power in {1_Civilization_Adj} lands, but could provide vital leadership, should a crisis arise.
You have unlocked Chola by building 3 Settlements adjacent to the coast.
[B]Ports[/B] were an important part of the [B]Meiji's[/B] identity.

A sailor muses, gazing out to sea: “the winter winds blow there, and never return.” He is not alone; the residents of {1_Civilization_Adj} coastal cities have created their own relationship with the sea, seeing in its movement the march of time’s arrow, and its capacity for change.
You have unlocked Meiji by having 3 Cities adjacent to the coast.
Have three [B]Siege units[/B].
[B]Siege units[/B] were an important part of [B]Mongolia's[/B] identity.

{1_Civilization_Adj} sieges spread terror among their rivals. Even the hint of an approaching army is enough to make mayors and viceroys weak. With its rise, a new line of experts in conquest arise, seeking to make their voices heard.
You have unlocked Mongolia by having 3 Siege units.
Have four [B]Temples[/B].
[B]Temples[/B] were an important part of [B]Siam's[/B] identity.

Hunters have chased the white elephant for years. Finally, they trap it in a clearing. Harnessed, it is returned to the {1_Civilization_Adj} court: a sign, the prophets say, of a great new order to come.
You have unlocked Siam by improving 3 Ivory Resources.
[B]Conquer[/B] three Cities.
[B]Conquest[/B] was an important part of [B]Spain's[/B] identity.
[B]Reconquer[/B] a lost Settlement.
[B]Conquest[/B] was an important part of [B]Spain's[/B] identity.

What was lost is now reconquered, as the {1_Civilization_Adj} banners rise again. But the warriors’ thirst for new conquests, and new shores is not yet slaked. A powerful group among these has arisen, seeking new foes, and new lands.
You have unlocked Spain by reconquering a lost settlement.
Have two Settlements on an [B]Island[/B] (a landmass with a maximum of 15 tiles).
[B]Islands[/B] were an important part of [B]Hawai'i's[/B] identity.
The {1_Civilization_Adj} steps upon the sea were halting at first, but now they grow increasingly confident. Sailors form their own class, have their own songs, and, increasingly, their own language.
You have unlocked Hawai'i by settling on 2 Islands.
Have four [B]Wonders[/B].
Have eight [B]Resources[/B] slotted in one Settlement.
[B]Resources[/B] were an important part of [B]Ming's[/B] identity.

The {1_Civilization_Adj} luxuries are the envy of the world. Its residents simply refer to it as the center of the world, bright, shining. One need not step outside its limits; the world is here, if one has silver.
You have unlocked Ming by slotting 8 Resources in one settlement.
Have three Settlements on [B]Tundra[/B].
[B]Tundra Settlements[/B] were an important part of [B]Russia's[/B] identity.

The tundra stretches to the horizon, a study in desolation. To choose to live here speaks to obstinacy and fortitude, but also to a poetry of the soul. This soul has become a rising metaphor for many in {1_Civilization_Adj} lands, even those of warmer climes.
You have unlocked Russia by having 3 settlements in Tundra biomes
Legendary Fortifications
Have at least 6 Walls or Fortifications in your Empire.
Your Civilization weathered the storm of the invasion crisis behind walls of legendary size and strength.
Confederation
Be the Suzerain of at least 3 City-States.
Your Civilization brought together various peoples during the invasion crisis to form a loose confederation.
Powerful Nobles
Have at least 3 Commanders with at least 5 Promotions in your Empire.
The invasion crisis elevated the military elite in your Civilization to a class of powerful nobles.
Reactionary Absolutism
Get an Enlightenment Dark Age
Your Civilization rejected the lessons of the Revolution and charted a different course.
National Guard
Have at least 8 War Support in a single war.
Your people embraced the Revolution wholeheartedly, defending it against all foes.
Stately Quadrille
Have at least 1 Ally and be involved in at least 10 Diplomatic Actions.
Your Civilization deftly maneuvered through the diplomatic turmoil of the Revolutions.
Minister the Sick
Have at least 4 Altars.
Your Civilization sought refuge in the divine.
Labor Shortage
Have at least 6 Settlements Infected at the same time.
With so many lost, your civilization had to change its approach to labor.
Imperial Ambition
Have conquered at least 4 Settlements and have no unhappy Settlements.
Your civilization conquered widely, and ruled well.
Inward Perfection
Have no more than 4 Settlements at end of the Age and have no unhappy Settlements.
Your civilization was known for just governance and happy people.
Contagion Theory
Have at least 4 Hospitals.
Your civilization recruited bold doctors and skilled healers during the plague.
Early Industrialization
Have a combination of at least 10 Sawmills and Gristmills.
Where labor power fell short, your people embraced machinery.
Religious Tolerance
Have at least 3 different Religions in your Settlements.
Your civilization was known for its diversity in belief.
Westphalian Sovereignty
Have a war declared against you.
Your civilization defended itself in a time of religious conflict.
Civilization[n] Unlocked
This Civilization will be available to play in the upcoming Age.
